annotation.spannedText: Children should receive two doses of MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Children should receive two doses of MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: MMR vaccine is very safe and effective

classMention.mentionClass: MMR vaccine is very safe and effective

annotation.spannedText: MMR vaccine is the best way to protect children against rubella and to prevent them from spreading the disease to pregnant women and their unborn babies

classMention.mentionClass: MMR vaccine is the best way to protect children against rubella and to prevent them from spreading the disease to pregnant women and their unborn babies

annotation.spannedText: Anyone born during or after 1957, who has never had rubella or has never been vaccinated, against rubella should receive at least one dose of MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Anyone born during or after 1957, who has never had rubella or has never been vaccinated, against rubella should receive at least one dose of MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: If you do not have written documentation of rubella immunity, you should get MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: If you do not have written documentation of rubella immunity, you should get MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: There is no harm in getting another dose of MMR vaccine if you may already be immune to rubella

classMention.mentionClass: There is no harm in getting another dose of MMR vaccine if you may already be immune to rubella

annotation.spannedText: Women who are planning to become pregnant should make sure they have a pre-pregnancy blood test to see if they are immune to rubella

classMention.mentionClass: Women who are planning to become pregnant should make sure they have a pre-pregnancy blood test to see if they are immune to rubella

annotation.spannedText: Most women of childbearing age were vaccinated as children with the MMR vaccine, but they should confirm this with their doctor

classMention.mentionClass: Most women of childbearing age were vaccinated as children with the MMR vaccine, but they should confirm this with their doctor

annotation.spannedText: If they need to get vaccinated for rubella, they should avoid becoming pregnant until one month (28 days) after receiving the MMR vaccine and, ideally, not until your immunity is confirmed by a blood test

classMention.mentionClass: If they need to get vaccinated for rubella, they should avoid becoming pregnant until one month (28 days) after receiving the MMR vaccine and, ideally, not until your immunity is confirmed by a blood test

annotation.spannedText: Pregnant women who are not protected against rubella should wait until after they have given birth to get MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Pregnant women who are not protected against rubella should wait until after they have given birth to get MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: unvaccinated people can get rubella while abroad can bring the disease into the United States and spread it to others

classMention.mentionClass: unvaccinated people can get rubella while abroad can bring the disease into the United States and spread it to others

annotation.spannedText: If an unvaccinated pregnant woman gets infected with rubella virus it can lead to miscarriage, or her baby can die before or just after birth

classMention.mentionClass: If an unvaccinated pregnant woman gets infected with rubella virus it can lead to miscarriage, or her baby can die before or just after birth

annotation.spannedText: she can pass the virus to her unborn baby who can develop serious birth defects, such as heart problems, loss of hearing and eyesight, intellectual disability, and liver or spleen damage

classMention.mentionClass: she can pass the virus to her unborn baby who can develop serious birth defects, such as heart problems, loss of hearing and eyesight, intellectual disability, and liver or spleen damage
